meanings.definition: A large self-service retail store selling food and household goods.
meanings.sent1: I went to the supermarket to buy some fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent2: My mom asked me to pick up some milk from the supermarket on my way home.
meanings.sent3: The supermarket had a sale on cookies, so I bought way too many!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the supermarket as she found her favorite brand of cereal.
meanings.sent5: The supermarket was bustling with shoppers, carts filled to the brim with groceries.

meanings.sent1: We always get our bread from the supermarket down the street.
meanings.sent2: I prefer to do my weekly shopping at the supermarket because it's convenient.
meanings.sent3: The supermarket cashier accidentally scanned the same item twice and had to fix it.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a supermarket of ideas, each aisle filled with creative possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The supermarket's aisles were neatly organized, making it easy to find everything on my list.
